Detailed Description

Print receipts composed of text and bitmaps from the Companion on the iDevice applications.

The callbacks that provide the information to be printed are defined within the ICAdministrationStandAloneDelegate protocol. The ICAdministrationDelegate property of the ICAdministration object must be set to a valid object that conforms to the mentioned protocol in order to be notified with the printing callbacks. Those provide the raw data and all the information needed to render the receipt.

Function Documentation

- (NSInteger) shouldAddSignature

This delegate method is called whenever the Companion needs to add a signature.

- (void) shouldCutPaper

This delegate method is called whenever the Companion needs to cut the paper.

- (NSInteger) shouldEndReceipt

This delegate method is called whenever the Companion needs to end printing a receipt.

- (void) shouldFeedPaperWithLines: (NSUInteger)  lines

This delegate method is called whenever the Companion needs to add empty lines when printing.

Parameters
linesThe number of lines to add
- (void) shouldPrintImage: (UIImage *)  image

This delegate method is called whenever an image is available for printing.

Parameters
imageAn UIImage object containing the image
- (void) shouldPrintRawText: (char *)  text
withCharset: (NSInteger)  charset
withFont: (UIFont *)  font
alignment: (UITextAlignment)  alignment
XScaling: (NSInteger)  xFactor
YScaling: (NSInteger)  yFactor
underline: (BOOL)  underline
bold: (BOOL)  bold 

This delegate method is called whenever a text string is available for printing.

This callback is called when formatted text is to be printed. It provides information on how the text should be rendered. This involves the following attributes:

  • The text font - The size of the font is not set by the terminal. This means that the iOS application is free to choose the appropriate text size.
  • The text charset - The charset of the text to display. This means that the iOS application shall apply the corresponding charset.
  • The alignment of the text (left, right or center)
  • The X scale ratio (this may be one of the following values: 1, 2 or 4)
  • The Y scale ratio (may be one of the values: 1, 2 or 4)
  • underlining


Parameters
textA char* containing the text to be printed
charsetThe charset used by the text
fontAn UIFont object including the name of the font that should be used to render the text string
alignmentThe alignment of the text
xFactorThe scaling factor to be applied to the text in the X direction
yFactorThe scaling factor to be applied to the text in the Y direction
underlineSpecifies whether the text should be underlined or not
boldBoolean that specifies whether the text should have a bold style
- (void) shouldPrintText: (NSString *)  text
withFont: (UIFont *)  font
alignment: (UITextAlignment)  alignment
XScaling: (NSInteger)  xFactor
YScaling: (NSInteger)  yFactor
underline: (BOOL)  underline

- (void) shouldPrintText: (NSString *)  text
withFont: (UIFont *)  font
andAlignment: (UITextAlignment)  alignment 

This delegate method is called whenever a text string is available for printing.

The font, size and alignment of the text are those used by default by the Companion. It is however possible to override them and use other values.

Parameters
textA NSString containing the text to be printed
fontAn UIFont object including the font and size to be applied to the text when printing
alignmentThe alignment of the text
- (void) shouldSendPclAddonInfos

This event is triggered when the iOS receives a PCL informations request from the SPM.

- (NSInteger) shouldStartReceipt: (NSInteger)  type

This delegate method is called whenever the Companion needs to start printing a receipt.

Parameters
typeThe receipt type
